results.name: Numbers that are congruent to {0, 4} mod 7.
comment: Nonnegative k such that k or 5*k + 1 is divisible by 7. - _Bruno Berselli_, Feb 13 2018
Maximum number of 2's possible in an infinite Minesweeper grid with n mines. The pattern of mines (x) that generates these 2's looks like "...xx.xx.xx...". - _Dmitry Kamenetsky_, Apr 14 2018
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,1,-1).
formula: a(n) = 7*n - a(n-1) - 10 for n>1, a(1)=0. - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 05 2010
a(n) = 2*(n - 1) + floor((3*n - 2 - (n mod 2))/2). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Mar 31 2014
